channel.title: RS player indexing
channel.description: Is there a reason why RS starts counting the index of players from 1 rather than from 0? Took me hours to find why my updating was doing weird, it was because I started counting from 0. Which would be the logical way imo.

item.title: RS player indexing
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Thanks for that clarification

Read full topic

item.title: RS player indexing
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Lothy:

You can start at index 0 in runescape classic. From memory I think index 0 in RS2 is used to store your player information client-side (so you wouldn’t want to tell the client to update that information with someone else’s).

correct the clients player is set into slot 0 for certain things.

Read full topic

@lothy wrote:

You can start at index 0 in runescape classic. From memory I think index 0 in RS2 is used to store your player information client-side (so you wouldn’t want to tell the client to update that information with someone else’s).

item.title: RS player indexing
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:1, topic:549216”]Is there a reason why RS starts counting the index of players from 1 rather than from 0?
Took me hours to find why my updating was doing weird, it was because I started counting from 0.
Which would be the logical way imo.[/quote]

No idea. Perhaps it was an artifact from loading players from a database where the rows start at 1 instead of 0.

Read full topic
